dtliExcerpt: Ms. Parker brings a sensual restlessness to Hedda that makes her destruction seem both inevitable and tragic. She moves through the role with a feline grace that suggests a creature born to hunt but trapped in a drawing room.
bwwExcerpt: And - oh, break, break my heart - the director of this "Hedda" is Ian Rickson, who this season delivered a nigh-perfect "Seagull" on Broadway, one of the best revivals I have ever, ever seen.Â That he is now responsible for one of the worst revivals I have ever, ever seen has me flummoxed. Mr. Rickson's "Seagull" was a fluidly integrated production in which everyone seemed to exist in the same moment and in the same universe. With this "Hedda" it's not just that ever
